tit.cmt: changed the title to match the style of the wiki article "伊勢物語"

sen.j: 平中物語（へいちゅうものがたり）は、平安時代に成立した歌物語（平仲物語とも書く）。
sen.e: Heichumonogatari is a story told with poems that was established in the Heian period (also written,"平仲物語").
The Tale of Heichu (平中物語 or 平仲物語 Heichu monogatari) is a story told through poems that was completed during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: "established" not natural here, so I changed it to "completed"; put both kanji readings in parenthesis; fixed grammar
sen.e: Heichu monogatari (The Tale of Heichu) (written 平中物語 or 平仲物語) is a story told through poems that was completed during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。

sen.e: The year of establishment and author are unknown.
The author and year of completion are unknown.
sen.cmt: "establishment" not natural here either, so I changed it to "completion"
sen.e: The author and year of completion are unknown.

sen.j: 現代に伝えられる伝本は、藤原定家の孫である冷泉為相による古写本1冊しかないという。
sen.e: The only existing copy is one that was copied by Tamesou REIZEI, a grandson of FUJIWARA no Sadaka.
The only existing copy is a reprint made by Tamesou REIZEI, a grandson of FUJIWARA no Sadaka.
sen.cmt: "copy" followed by "copied" sounds redundant, so I changed the latter to "reprint" and fixed the grammar accordingly
sen.e: The only existing copy is a reprint made by Tamesuke REIZEI, a grandson of FUJIWARA no Teika.
sen.cmt: 人名の読みを修正しました。

sen.j: 主人公の「平中」は、平安時代中期の歌人、平貞文（たいらのさだふみ又はさだぶん）。
sen.e: The main character "Heichu" is the mid-Heian period poet, TAIRA no Sadabumi (or Sadabun).
The main character, "Heichu," is a mid-Heian period poet named TAIRA no Sadabumi (or Sadabun).
The main character, 'Heichu,' is a mid-Heian period poet named TAIRA no Sadabumi (or Sadabun).

sen.j: 『伊勢物語』の影響が大きい作品であるが伊勢物語に比べ地文が多いという。
sen.e: It is heavily influenced by "Isemonogatari", but has more main text compared to Isemonogatari.
The story was greatly influenced by "The Tales of Ise" (Ise monogatari), but has a comparatively longer main text.
sen.cmt: heavily→greatly; gave translated version of "Isemonogatari" and added parenthesis; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: The story was greatly influenced by "Ise monogatari" (The Tales of Ise), but has a comparatively longer main text.
sen.cmt: "本のタイトル " (補足) の表現に変更しました。

sen.j: 角川文庫、日本古典文学全集所収。
sen.e: Available as part of Kadokawa-bunko or the Complete Japanese Classic Collection.
Available as part of the Kadokawa Book Collection or the Complete Japanese Classic Collection.
Available as part of the Kadokawa Bunko books or in the Nihon Koten Bungaku Zenshu (The Collections of Japanese Classical Literature).
